title: Help the Puppy Get Ready for Bed
description_teacher: Students practice sequencing by arranging 3 pictures of a puppy's bedtime routine in logical order. This builds foundational understanding of algorithms as ordered steps.
student_prompt: Put the pictures in order to help the puppy get ready for bed!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put the pictures in order to help the puppy get ready for bed!

correct.message: Great job! The puppy is ready for bed!
correct.audio_tts: Great job! The puppy is ready for bed!

incorrect.message: Try again! What does the puppy do first?
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Think about what the puppy does first.
incorrect.hint_text: We put on pajamas before brushing teeth!

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - picture-based sequencing activity

title: Making a Sandwich: What's the Right Order?
description_teacher: Students arrange pictures showing how to make a sandwich in the correct order, reinforcing the concept that steps must follow a logical sequence.
student_prompt: Drag the pictures to show how to make a sandwich!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Drag the pictures to show how to make a sandwich!

correct.message: Yummy! You made a perfect sandwich!
correct.audio_tts: Yummy! You made a perfect sandwich!

incorrect.message: Not quite! What do we need first?
incorrect.audio_tts: Not quite! What do we need first to make a sandwich?
incorrect.hint_text: We need bread before we can add anything!

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - everyday algorithm with familiar task

title: Getting Dressed: Morning Routine
description_teacher: Students sequence pictures of getting dressed, understanding that some actions must come before others (underwear before pants!).
student_prompt: Put the pictures in order to get dressed for school!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put the pictures in order to get dressed for school!

correct.message: Perfect! Now you're ready for school!
correct.audio_tts: Perfect! Now you're ready for school!

incorrect.message: Try again! What goes on first?
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Think about what we put on first.
incorrect.hint_text: Underwear goes on before pants!

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - logical sequencing with clear dependencies

title: Washing Hands: Do It Right!
description_teacher: Students arrange pictures showing proper handwashing steps, connecting algorithms to health routines.
student_prompt: Show the right way to wash your hands!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Show the right way to wash your hands!

correct.audio_tts: Great! Your hands are clean and healthy!

incorrect.message: Try again! What do we do first?
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! What do we do first when washing hands?
incorrect.hint_text: We need water before we can use soap!

title: Plant a Seed: Steps in Order
description_teacher: Students arrange pictures showing how to plant a seed in the correct order, building on K sequencing with more steps and complexity.
student_prompt: Put the pictures in order to plant a seed!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put the pictures in order to plant a seed!

correct.message: Perfect! Your seed will grow into a plant!
correct.audio_tts: Perfect! Your seed will grow into a beautiful plant!

incorrect.message: Not quite! Think about what you need first.
incorrect.audio_tts: Not quite! Think about what you need before you can plant.
incorrect.hint_text: You need a pot before you can add soil!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from coding-heavy G1.01 to picture-based sequencing

title: What Happens Next? Story Sequence
description_teacher: Students view a 3-picture sequence and predict what comes next from visual choices, practicing algorithmic prediction.
student_prompt: Look at the story. What happens next?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Look at the story. What happens next?

correct.audio_tts: Yes! That's what happens next in the story!

incorrect.message: Try again! Look at what the cat is doing.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Look carefully at what the cat is doing.
incorrect.hint_text: The cat is walking toward something!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.02 (trace algorithm) to visual prediction

title: Find the Missing Step
description_teacher: Students identify which step is missing from a sequence, building debugging skills through picture-based problem solving.
student_prompt: One picture is missing! Click on what's missing from the steps.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: One picture is missing! Click on what's missing from the steps.

correct.message: Great! You found the missing step!
correct.audio_tts: Great! You found the missing step!

incorrect.message: Not quite! Look at all the steps carefully.
incorrect.audio_tts: Not quite! Look at all the steps to see what's missing.
incorrect.hint_text: What do we do after mixing but before baking?

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.03 (identify incorrect steps) to visual debugging

title: Two Ways to Do It: Which is Better?
description_teacher: Students compare two different sequences for the same task and identify which one works better or is more efficient.
student_prompt: Look at both ways. Which way works better? Click on it!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Look at both ways. Which way works better? Click on it!

correct.audio_tts: Yes! That way works better and is easier!

incorrect.message: Look again. Which way has all the steps?
incorrect.audio_tts: Look again. Which way has all the steps we need?
incorrect.hint_text: Count the steps in each way!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.04 (compare algorithms) to visual comparison

title: Choose the Path: If-Then Decisions
description_teacher: Students follow a sequence that includes an if-then decision, clicking on the correct path based on a condition. Bridges to conditional logic.
student_prompt: The robot needs to go around the puddle. Click to show the right path!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: The robot needs to go around the puddle. Click to show the right path!

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You helped the robot go around the puddle!

incorrect.message: Try again! What should the robot do when it sees the puddle?
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! What should the robot do when it sees the puddle?
incorrect.hint_text: The robot needs to turn when it sees a puddle!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.01 (write if-then) to picture-based conditional

title: Patterns that Repeat: Can You See It?
description_teacher: Students identify which part of a visual sequence repeats multiple times, building foundation for loop concepts through pattern recognition.
student_prompt: Which part repeats over and over? Click on it!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Which part repeats over and over? Click on it!

correct.audio_tts: Yes! You found the pattern that repeats over and over!

incorrect.message: Look again. What do you see more than once?
incorrect.audio_tts: Look again. What do you see happening more than once?
incorrect.hint_text: Find the steps that happen again and again!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.02 (repeat statement) to visual pattern identification bridging to loops

title: Follow the Steps: What Does It Make?
description_teacher: Students follow a 6-8 step visual sequence and predict the final result from picture choices.
student_prompt: Follow all the steps. What will you make?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Follow all the steps. What will you make?

correct.message: Correct! That's what the steps make!
correct.audio_tts: Correct! If you follow all the steps, you make that!

incorrect.message: Try again! Follow each step carefully.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Follow each step carefully to see what you make.
incorrect.hint_text: Look at what you're adding in each step!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.03 (trace with branching) to outcome prediction

title: Guide the Robot Through the Maze
description_teacher: Students click directional arrows to guide a robot through a simple maze, applying sequential thinking in a problem-solving context.
student_prompt: Click the arrows to guide the robot to the star!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Click the arrows to guide the robot to the star!

correct.message: Amazing! The robot reached the star!
correct.audio_tts: Amazing! You guided the robot to the star!

incorrect.message: Not quite! Try a different path.
incorrect.audio_tts: Not quite! Try a different path to reach the star.
incorrect.hint_text: The robot needs to go around the walls!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.04 (unplugged maze) to interactive digital navigation

title: Animal Pattern: What Comes Next?
description_teacher: Students identify and complete a simple AB pattern using animal pictures, building pattern recognition skills that underpin algorithmic thinking.
student_prompt: Look at the pattern. What comes next?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Look at the pattern. What comes next?

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You found what comes next in the pattern!

incorrect.message: Try again! Look at what repeats.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Look at which animals repeat.
incorrect.hint_text: Dog, cat, dog, cat... what comes next?

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - AB pattern recognition

title: Color Pattern: Red, Blue, Red, Blue
description_teacher: Students complete a simple color pattern, reinforcing pattern recognition with a different attribute (color).
student_prompt: What color comes next in the pattern?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: What color comes next in the pattern?

correct.audio_tts: Great! You know which color comes next!

incorrect.audio_tts: Look again! What color repeats over and over?
incorrect.hint_text: Red, blue, red, blue... what's next?

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - AB pattern with colors

title: Shape Pattern: Circle, Square, Circle
description_teacher: Students complete a shape pattern, applying pattern recognition to geometric attributes.

correct.message: Yes! You found the next shape!
correct.audio_tts: Yes! You found which shape comes next!

incorrect.message: Try again! Look at the shapes.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Look carefully at the shapes.
incorrect.hint_text: Circle, square, circle, square... what's next?

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - AB pattern with shapes

title: Big-Small Pattern
description_teacher: Students complete a pattern based on size attribute (big-small), expanding pattern understanding.
student_prompt: What size comes next? Big or small?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: What size comes next? Big or small?

correct.message: Perfect! You know big and small!
correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You found which size comes next!

incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Is the next one big or small?
incorrect.hint_text: Big, small, big, small... what's next?

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - AB pattern with size

title: Find the Repeating Part
short_name: Identify repeating unit in ABC pattern
description_teacher: Students identify which sequence of items repeats in a longer pattern, building awareness of reusable units.
student_prompt: Click on the part that repeats over and over!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Click on the part that repeats over and over!

correct.audio_tts: Great! You found the part that repeats!

incorrect.message: Try again! What do you see more than once?
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! What group do you see more than once?
incorrect.hint_text: Look for a group of items that happens again and again!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.01 (find repeated blocks) to visual pattern recognition

title: Story Pattern Match
description_teacher: Students match pictures showing a repeating story sequence to the visual pattern it creates.
student_prompt: Match each story to its pattern!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Match each story to its pattern!

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You matched all the stories to their patterns!

incorrect.message: Try again! Look at what repeats in each story.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Look at what repeats in each story.
incorrect.hint_text: Find the part of the story that happens over and over!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.02 (match picture story to code) to pattern matching

title: Template Time: Which Ones Are the Same?
description_teacher: Students identify which pictures follow the same basic structure/template, building understanding of reusable solutions.
student_prompt: Click on all the pictures that are made the same way!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Click on all the pictures that are made the same way!

correct.message: Yes! They're all made the same way!
correct.audio_tts: Yes! All those pictures follow the same pattern!

incorrect.message: Look again! Which ones have the same structure?
incorrect.audio_tts: Look again! Which ones have the same structure or design?
incorrect.hint_text: Look at how the colors and shapes are arranged!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.03 (recognize template) to visual template identification

title: Make Your Own Pattern
short_name: Create repeating pattern by arranging items
description_teacher: Students create their own repeating pattern by dragging items into slots, applying pattern knowledge creatively.
student_prompt: Make a pattern that repeats! Drag the items.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Make a pattern that repeats! Drag the items.

correct.audio_tts: Great! Your pattern repeats over and over!

incorrect.message: Almost! Make sure your pattern repeats.
incorrect.audio_tts: Almost! Make sure the same group repeats over and over.
incorrect.hint_text: Pick a group and repeat it at least two times!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.04 (build repeating script) to visual pattern creation

title: Find All the Patterns
description_teacher: Students identify all the different patterns that repeat in a complex visual sequence, building advanced pattern recognition.
student_prompt: This picture has patterns! Click on all the parts that repeat.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: This picture has patterns! Click on all the parts that repeat.

correct.message: Amazing! You found all the patterns!
correct.audio_tts: Amazing! You found all the parts that repeat!

incorrect.message: Good start! Are there more patterns?
incorrect.audio_tts: Good start! Look again - are there more patterns?
incorrect.hint_text: Look for different groups that repeat!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.01 (identify repeating sections) to complex pattern identification

title: Short-Cut the Repeat: Circle It Once
short_name: Identify what to repeat instead of showing multiple times
description_teacher: Students identify the core unit that could be repeated instead of showing it many times, bridging to loop concept.
student_prompt: These steps happen 3 times! Circle just one group that repeats.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: These steps happen 3 times! Circle just one group that repeats.

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! Instead of showing it 3 times, we could just say repeat this!

incorrect.message: Try again! Find what happens over and over.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Find the group that happens over and over.
incorrect.hint_text: Look for the same steps happening again and again!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.02 (replace with loop) - bridges to loop concept through visual shortcut

title: Customize the Template
description_teacher: Students start with a template pattern and customize it by changing specific elements while keeping the overall structure, understanding templates as reusable frameworks.
student_prompt: Change the colors but keep the same pattern!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Change the colors but keep the same pattern!

correct.message: Great! You kept the pattern but made it your own!
correct.audio_tts: Great! You kept the same pattern but changed the colors!

incorrect.message: Almost! Keep the same repeating structure.
incorrect.audio_tts: Almost! Remember to keep the same repeating structure.
incorrect.hint_text: The pattern should still be ABC ABC, just with different items!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.03 (use template project) to visual template customization

title: Pattern Prediction: What Will It Make?
description_teacher: Students view a small repeating pattern and predict what it will look like when repeated many times, building mental model of iteration.
student_prompt: If we repeat this pattern 5 times, what will it look like?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: If we repeat this pattern 5 times, what will it look like?

correct.audio_tts: Correct! When you repeat the pattern, it makes that!

incorrect.message: Try again! Count how many times it repeats.
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Count how many times the pattern repeats.
incorrect.hint_text: The pattern ABC repeated 5 times makes ABCABCABCABCABC!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.04 (predict pattern output) to visual iteration prediction

title: Sort by Color
description_teacher: Students sort colored objects into matching color bins, learning data organization by single attribute.
student_prompt: Drag each toy to the bin with the same color!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Drag each toy to the bin with the same color!

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You sorted all the colors!

incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Put each toy in the bin with the same color.

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - single attribute sorting

title: Big or Small?
description_teacher: Students sort items into big and small categories, understanding classification by size.
student_prompt: Put the big things here and the small things there!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put the big things here and the small things there!

correct.message: Great! You know big and small!
correct.audio_tts: Great! You sorted big and small!

incorrect.audio_tts: Look again. Which ones are bigger?

title: What Kind Is It?
description_teacher: Students sort items by type (animals vs toys vs food), learning categorical classification.
student_prompt: Put each picture where it belongs!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put each picture where it belongs!

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You put everything in the right group!

incorrect.message: Try again! What kind of thing is it?
incorrect.audio_tts: Try again! Is it an animal, a toy, or food?

title: Count and Compare
short_name: Count items and identify which has more
description_teacher: Students count items in two groups and click on the group with more, introducing quantitative comparison.
student_prompt: Which group has more? Click on it!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Which group has more? Click on it!

correct.audio_tts: Yes! That group has more!

incorrect.audio_tts: Count again! Which group has more?

title: Sort by Two Things
description_teacher: Students sort items considering two attributes (e.g., color AND size), advancing classification skills.
student_prompt: Sort by color AND size! Put them in the right boxes.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Sort by color AND size! Put them in the right boxes.

correct.audio_tts: Amazing! You sorted by both color and size!

incorrect.message: Check the color AND the size!
incorrect.audio_tts: Check both the color and the size!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.01 - picture-based multi-attribute sorting

title: More, Less, or Same?
description_teacher: Students compare groups of items and identify relationships (more, less, same).
student_prompt: Look at both groups. Are there more, less, or the same? Click your answer!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Look at both groups. Are there more, less, or the same? Click your answer!

correct.audio_tts: Correct! You compared the groups!

incorrect.audio_tts: Count both groups carefully!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.02 - visual quantitative comparison

title: Numbers Tell Us Things
description_teacher: Students sort cards showing numbers vs other information, understanding numeric data.
student_prompt: Put the number cards in one box and the other cards in the other box!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put the number cards in one box and the other cards in the other box!

correct.audio_tts: Great! You sorted the numbers!

incorrect.audio_tts: Which ones show numbers?

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.03 - visual numeric recognition

title: Make a Picture Chart
description_teacher: Students drag pictures to create a simple picture chart showing survey results.
student_prompt: Make a chart! Drag one picture for each person's answer.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Make a chart! Drag one picture for each person's answer.

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! Your chart shows the data!

incorrect.message: Check how many said each answer!
incorrect.audio_tts: Check how many people said each answer!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.04 - picture chart creation

title: Number or Not?
description_teacher: Students classify various data as numeric or non-numeric, building data type awareness.
student_prompt: Is it a number? Yes or No?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Is it a number? Yes or No?

correct.audio_tts: Excellent! You know which data is numbers!

incorrect.message: Think about which ones are numbers!
incorrect.audio_tts: Think about which ones are counting numbers!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.01 - bridges to data types concept

title: Make a Variable Box
description_teacher: Students drag a value into a labeled 'variable box', understanding variables as named storage. Bridges to coding concept.
student_prompt: Put the score in the Score box! This is like a variable in coding.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put the score in the Score box! This is like a variable in coding.

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! Variables in coding work just like that!

incorrect.message: Which number goes in which box?
incorrect.audio_tts: Which number goes in which box?

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.02 - bridges to variable concept through pictures

title: What Can Change? What Stays the Same?
description_teacher: Students sort data into 'changes' vs 'stays same' categories, understanding variable vs constant concept.
student_prompt: Sort these: Which ones change? Which stay the same?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Sort these: Which ones change? Which stay the same?

correct.audio_tts: Great! You know what changes and what stays the same!

incorrect.message: Think about what could be different!
incorrect.audio_tts: Think about what could be different each time!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.03 - variable vs constant through scenarios

title: Track the Score!
short_name: Use variable to track changing data
description_teacher: Students update a 'score variable' as events happen, understanding how variables track changing information.
student_prompt: Update the score after each event! Drag the new score.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Update the score after each event! Drag the new score.

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You tracked how the score changed!

incorrect.message: Check what happened after each event!
incorrect.audio_tts: Check what happened to the score after each event!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.04 - variable tracking through game scenario

title: Make a Simple Table
short_name: Organize data into rows and columns
description_teacher: Students drag data cards into a simple 2-column table, organizing collected data.
student_prompt: Put the data in the table! Each row is one person.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put the data in the table! Each row is one person.

correct.audio_tts: Excellent! Your table is organized perfectly!

incorrect.message: Check which column each data goes in!
incorrect.audio_tts: Check which column each piece of data goes in!

title: Ask and Count
short_name: Collect data by asking yes/no question
description_teacher: Students click to count responses to a simple yes/no question shown in pictures.

correct.audio_tts: You counted right!

incorrect.audio_tts: Count again!

notes_redesign: NEW K skill - basic data collection

title: Which Has More?
description_teacher: Students compare two groups of collected data and identify which has more.
student_prompt: Which color did more people pick? Click on it!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Which color did more people pick? Click on it!

correct.audio_tts: Correct! More people picked that one!

incorrect.audio_tts: Count both colors!

title: Make a List
description_teacher: Students drag response pictures to make a simple list of answers.
student_prompt: Make a list! Drag each person's answer.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Make a list! Drag each person's answer.

correct.audio_tts: Great! You made a list of all the answers!

incorrect.audio_tts: Put each answer in the list!

title: Take a Survey: Click Your Choice
description_teacher: Students click their answer to a simple survey question, understanding data collection participation.
student_prompt: What's your favorite? Click on it!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: What's your favorite? Click on it!

correct.audio_tts: Thanks for answering the survey!

title: Ask the Class
description_teacher: Students count responses from a class survey shown visually.
student_prompt: Count: How many picked each snack?

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Count: How many picked each snack?

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! You counted all the responses!

incorrect.audio_tts: Count each group carefully!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G1.01 - visual survey counting

title: Compare the Data
description_teacher: Students compare three groups of data and answer questions about them.
student_prompt: Which snack got the most votes? Click on it!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Which snack got the most votes? Click on it!

correct.audio_tts: Yes! That snack got the most votes!

incorrect.audio_tts: Count how many voted for each snack!

title: Make the List
description_teacher: Students drag data items to organize collected information into a list.
student_prompt: Put the data in a list! Drag them in order.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Put the data in a list! Drag them in order.

correct.audio_tts: Great! You organized the data in a list!

incorrect.audio_tts: Check if you have all the data!

title: Collect by Watching
description_teacher: Students count occurrences in a scene (observation data collection).
student_prompt: Watch the playground. Count how many kids use each toy!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Watch the playground. Count how many kids use each toy!

correct.audio_tts: Great! You observed and counted carefully!

incorrect.audio_tts: Look carefully at each part of the picture!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.01 - observation data collection

title: Fill the Table
description_teacher: Students drag data into a simple two-column table.
student_prompt: Fill in the table! Drag each data piece to the right spot.

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Fill in the table! Drag each data piece to the right spot.

correct.audio_tts: Perfect! Your table is organized well!

incorrect.message: Check which column it goes in!
incorrect.audio_tts: Check which column each data goes in!

title: Survey the Class
description_teacher: Students choose which question would make a good survey for the class.
student_prompt: Which question is best for a class survey? Click on it!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Which question is best for a class survey? Click on it!

correct.audio_tts: Great! That's a good survey question!

incorrect.message: Think about what everyone could answer!
incorrect.audio_tts: Think about what question everyone could answer!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.03 - survey design understanding

title: Find What's Missing
description_teacher: Students identify missing or incomplete data in a visual table.
student_prompt: Look at the table. Click on the missing data!

student_prompt_audio.tts_text: Look at the table. Click on the missing data!

correct.audio_tts: You found all the missing data!

incorrect.audio_tts: Look for empty spots or incomplete information!

notes_redesign: Redesigned from G2.04 - data completeness check

description_teacher: Students create simple bar chart from data through picture-based interaction.
